oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-02-04 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 4, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys, guest performers Johnnie & Jack with Ruby Wells and Kitty Wells, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Pap's Jug Band, Minnie Pearl, and Bashful Brother Oswald. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rod Brasfield; Johnnie & Jack; Ruby Wells; Kitty Wells; Pap's Jug Band
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff -- John Henry (Roy Acuff) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Roy Acuff) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Johnnie & Jack, and Ruby Wells -- I Want To Be Loved (Johnnie & Jack, Kitty Wells) -- Roy Acuff talks -- Shake My Mother's Hand For Me (Roy Acuff, Kitty Wells, Johnnie & Jack) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Prince Albert jingle (Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Pap's Jug Band -- Maybellene (Pap's Jug Band)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Minnie Pearl; Johnnie & Jack; Wells, Ruby; Wells, Kitty; Wright, Johnnie, 1914-2011; Anglin, Jack, 1916-1963; Pap's Jug Band; Bashful Brother Oswald; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Forrester, Howdy, 1922-1987; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982
